meanings.definition: Tirr (verb): to pull or drag with force
meanings.sent1: She had to tirr the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a rope to tirr the tree stump out of the ground.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to tirr the big bone, but it was too heavy for him.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind seemed to tirr the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: He had to tirr with all his might to open the stubborn door.

meanings.definition: Tirr (noun): a strong pull or tug
meanings.sent1: With a sudden tirr, she yanked the rope and the curtain fell down.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman felt a strong tirr on his fishing line.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy gave a playful tirr on the toy, trying to play tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The tirr of the vacuum cleaner pulled the dust bunnies from under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The tirr of the magnet was so strong, it could lift the metal key easily.
